derivedData.extendedName: Later Medieval German Princes  1440 to 1493 AD

troopOptions.description: Deep mounted formations using men at arms with barding in front and less well equipped men-at-arms in rear ranks
Mercenary bowmen or crossbowmen or handgunners
City militia crossbowmen, possibly with pavises
City militia skirmishing bowmen or handgunners
Separately deployed halberdiers, some with armor
War wagons manned by crossbowmen, handgunners, and light guns
Hungarian horse archers, Szekelers, or Tartars
Hungarian horse archers, Szekelers, or Tartars
Horsedrawn fortified wagons with crossbowmen and handgunners

derivedData.extendedName: Medieval Danish and Kalmar Union  1350 to 1523 AD

troopOptions.description: Burgundian or mercenary crossbowmen (or longbowmen, after 1430 AD)
Burgundian or Picard crossbowmen (or longbowmen, after 1430)
Ordonnance bowmen: mostly equipped with longbows, but some crossbows
Francs bowmen with some arriere-ban, garrison, or militia bowmen or crossbowmen

battleCardEntries.note: Wagon laager and/or chain-linked sections of palisade.  (in 1453: Ditch, Bank, and Stakes)

troopOptions.description: Ordonnance bowmen now fighting while mounted: mostly equipped with longbows, but some crossbows
Garrison or militia bowmen or crossbowmen
Feudal or mercenary men-at-arms and sergeants
Organ guns, bombards, and various other pieces
Ordonnance pikemen, or mixed formations of pikemen and longbowmen
Organ guns, bombards, and various other pieces
Frisian dardiers armed with two javelins, or youths with javelins

derivedData.extendedName: Later Medieval German Citystates  1440 to 1493 AD

troopOptions.description: Deep mounted formations using men at arms with barding in front and less well equipped men-at-arms in rear ranks
City militia crossbowmen, some with pavises or armor
Heerban armed with crossbow or bow
Mercenary bowmen or crossbowmen or handgunners
